telegraph.datagen.cellmix.cellmix module¶

telegraph.datagen.cellmix.cellmix._cellmix_type_balanced(ad_sc: AnnData, n_spots: int, n_cells_per_spot: int = 10, n_types_per_spot: int = 3, label_col: str | None = None, add_spatial_structure: bool = True, encode_spatial: bool = False, n_spatial_grad: None | int = None, n_interactions: None | int = None, effect_size: int = 10, p_signal_spots: float = 0.5)[source]¶

creates ‘mixed’ data akin to spot-based data that will have a pre-specified average number of cell types per spot as well as pre-defined number of cells per spot

telegraph.datagen.cellmix.cellmix._downsample(adata: AnnData, downsample: List[float] | float | None = None)[source]¶

downsamples exprssion according to a given percentage. the new library size of each observation will be downsample % of the original one.

telegraph.datagen.cellmix.cellmix.cellmix(ad_sc: AnnData, n_spots: int, n_cells_per_spot: int = 10, n_types_per_spot: int = 3, label_col: str | None = None, downsample: List[float] | float | None = None, encode_spatial: bool = False, n_spatial_grad: None | int = None, n_interactions: bool | None = None, effect_size: int = 10)[source]¶

pretty wrapper for cellmix

telegraph.datagen.cellmix.cellmix.random() → x in the interval [0, 1).¶
